line_1: Her sense informs, and sooths and cheers;
line_2: Her hand restrains the widow's tears,

line_1: Whose dreary way no sprightly carol chears.
line_2: Whose wounded bosom drinks her falling tears,
Time passes on, the truth itself appears,

line_1: Thus for awhile the sun the welkin chears,
line_2: Some deadly fiend to blast our joy appears;

line_1: Thus for awhile the sun the welkin chears,
line_2: But soon he hides his head, and melts in dropping tears.

line_1: My noon conducted, and my evening cheers,
line_2: W*, whose dear friendship in the dawning years

line_1: No friendly Voice my lonely Mansion cheers;
line_2: All fly th' Infection of the Widow's Tears:

line_1: The gladsome sun all nature cheers,
line_2: Still dwells his mind with gloomy fears,

line_1: His spirits with celestial fragrance chears.
line_2: The sacred vision to the youth appears,

line_1: "A Power the truly contrite Heart that chears;
line_2: Let fall adown his silver Beard some Tears.

line_1: "A Power the truly contrite Heart that chears;
line_2: " T' undo the Past, and eke your broken Years:

line_1: "A Power the truly contrite Heart that chears;
Thy voice the shuddering suppliant chears,
line_2: With Mercy calms her torturing fears,

line_1: There Freedom's praise no more the valley chears,
line_2: Nor bard, nor sage, nor martial chief appears,

line_1: But nought her rayless melancholy cheers,
line_2: Or sooths her breast, or stops her streaming tears.

line_1: The wide spread waste no gentle fountain cheers,
